q: What are the ways to get occupational therapy?
a: You can get occupational therapy free through the NHS or social services, depending on your situation. You can also pay for it yourself by finding a qualified and registered occupational therapist.

q: How can occupational therapy help?
a: Occupational therapy can help with practical tasks if you are physically disabled, recovering from an illness or operation, have learning disabilities, have mental health problems, or are getting older. Occupational therapists can assess your daily life activities and find alternative ways for you to do them.

a: You can find a qualified and registered occupational therapist by checking the online register of health and care professionals provided by the Health & Care Professions Council (HCPC). The Royal College of Occupational Therapists also lists qualified occupational therapists.
